title: 104_hr2456
content: The "Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995" is the short title of this Act. It includes amendments related to the Civil Service Retirement System. The "Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995" includes an amendment to Subchapter III of chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code, adding a section on limitations relating to Members' service periods and separation dates. The "Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995" added a section on limitations regarding Members' service periods and separation dates. This section applies to individuals serving as Members on or after the effective date, excluding reemployed annuitants whose annuity started before that date. It deems separation for Members who completed the maximum allowable service period before or on the effective date. The "Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995" added a section on limitations regarding Members' service periods and separation dates. It deems separation for Members who completed the maximum allowable service period. This subsection applies to Members described in subsection (b)(1)(A) or (B). The "Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995" added a section on limitations for Members' service periods and separation dates. This subsection applies to Members described in subsection (b)(1)(A) or (B). Members must actually separate to be eligible for an annuity, using their age and service as of the separation date. Requirements for annuity computation are met based on the deemed separation date. For annuity computation, average pay is determined without post-separation service, reductions are based on age, and total service is calculated accordingly. Limitations on average pay and final pay are also based on the deemed separation date. Deadlines tied to separation date use the actual separation date for application. Determinations on marital status are made as needed. For annuity computation, average pay is determined without post-separation service, reductions are based on age, and total service is calculated accordingly. Limitations on average pay and final pay are also based on the deemed separation date. Deadlines tied to separation date use the actual separation date for application. Determinations on marital status are made as needed. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director have jurisdiction over relevant matters. This section of the Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995 will take effect at the beginning of the next Congress. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS RELATING TO THE FEDERAL EMPLOYEES' RETIREMENT SYSTEM. Limitations relating to Members. Sec. 8404 of title 5, United States Code, sets limitations on member service, including defining the maximum allowable period of member service and the deemed separation date for Members. Sec. 8404 of title 5, United States Code, defines terms related to member service, including deemed separation and member service. This section applies to individuals serving as Members after the effective date, excluding reemployed annuitants. Any Member who completes the maximum allowable period of member service before the effective date is deemed to have separated from service. Any Member who completes the maximum allowable period of member service on or after the effective date of this section shall be deemed to have separated from service. Such Members may not remain or become subject to the Federal Employees' Retirement System and shall be treated as former Members while serving in Congress. The subsection applies to Members described in subsection (b)(1)(A) or (B) who must have actual separation to be eligible for an annuity. Age and service requirements are based on the deemed separation date, except for eligibility for an annuity supplement under section 8421, which is based on actual age. For annuity computations, the Member's actual age is used. Average pay excludes post-separation service. An annuity supplement is calculated accordingly. Deadlines and marital status are determined based on actual separation date. Military service periods are considered for eligibility. The separation date for military service credit is the actual separation date of the Member. Contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund are prohibited after the effective date of this section. Regulations for implementation may be prescribed by the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The Limited Congressional Pension Act of 1995 will take effect at the beginning of the next Congress after its enactment.
